newsitem.title: USA: BankUnited subsidiary sells $50 mln equity.
newsitem.headline: BankUnited subsidiary sells $50 mln equity.

text.p: BankUnited Financial Corp said on Monday that its subsidiary, BankUnited Capital, sold $50 million in new equity capital through the private placement of redeemable trust preferred securities.
The securities have an annual dividend rate of 10.25 percent, which is payable semi-annually, beginning June 1997.
BankUnited said that proceeds from the sale would be used for general corporate purposes, including capital contributions to BankUnited, FSB.
Friedman, Billings, Ramsey & Co and Raymond James & Associates Inc served as placement agents for the offering.
